definition: to excuse/to forgive/to bear with/to contain
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: I hope you will be magnanimous enough to excuse any incorrect behaviour on my part.
sentences.chinese: 對不住的地方，望您海量包涵。

sentences.english: The close-ups show a different side to bubbles, with the surface textures
sentences.chinese: 這些特寫表現了肥皂泡不同的一面，包涵表面的結構。

sentences.english: The inset demonstrates a typical giant cell with a round, pink intracytoplasmic inclusion.
sentences.chinese: 插圖顯示典型的鉅細胞，圓形，有粉紅色胞質包涵體。

sentences.english: Please excuse this _ apology for a meal.
sentences.chinese: 請包涵這頓不像樣的飯菜。

sentences.english: Some tension, and got bit wrong.
sentences.chinese: 難免緊張出錯，多多包涵與指教。

sentences.english: I cannot but hope the candid reader will give some allowance for it.
sentences.chinese: 我只有希望公正的讀者多少包涵一些。

sentences.english: I can only express the hope that my readers will understand my difficult position, and will be indulgent;
sentences.chinese: 我只希望讀者能夠理解我的立場及苦處，多多包涵。

sentences.english: ResultsIt was difficult to isolate inclusion body from the debris by differential centrifugation.
sentences.chinese: 結果差速離心很難完全將包涵體和細菌碎片分開。

sentences.english: Intranuclear inclusions were difficult to visualize.
The formation of inclusion bodies is morphologic evidence of viral cytocidal infection.
sentences.chinese: 包涵體形成是病毒殺細胞性感染的形態學證據。

sentences.english: This screamed to be analyzed much beyond the traditional meaning associated with the number.
sentences.chinese: 其中想必包涵着“九”這個數字傳統意義之外的東西。

sentences.english: Since it is a catchall phrase for a variety of energy sources, any definition has to be broad.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這是一個包涵了多種能源短語，任何定義來概括。

sentences.english: Eosinophilic inclusions were showed in or out the cells.
sentences.chinese: 細胞內外見紅染的包涵體。

sentences.english: Induced by IPTG, was inclusion body protein.
sentences.chinese: 通過IPTG誘導，獲得包涵體表達蛋白。

sentences.english: Inclusion bodies were usually round and different in size.
sentences.chinese: 包涵體常爲圓形，大小不一。

definition: to contain/to hold/content/(of a poem etc) full of implicit meaning
to point out mistakes or weak points for correction/to comment/criticism
to contain in a concealed form/to keep covered up/implicit
(conventional letter ending) words cannot fully express what is in my heart (idiom)
to empathize/to allow (for sth)/to show understanding/to appreciate
to mention some but omit many others (idiom)/to leave out much more than one includes
to omit/to delete/to leave out/to neglect/to skip over
